description: Single storey rear extension; rear roof extension to the main roofslope with three dormer windows; alterations to existing first floor rear outrigger extension; installation of three rooflights to front roofslope; and associated internal and external alterations involving replacement of all timber single glazed sash windows on the front and rear elevation with double-glazed timber sash windows to match original
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with:

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| The hereby approved rooflights to the front roof slope of the hereby development shall be Conservation style rooflights and lie flush with the roof and shall be retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason:  To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, and to safeguard the character and appearance of the conservation area in accordance with policies D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and policies 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved drawings, the replacement windows shall be timber and, with the exception of being double glazed, match the opening style, frame thickness, colour and detailing of the existing windows being replaced.

Reason: To protect the historic and special character of the dwellinghouse and conservation area in accordance with policy 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved drawings, all upper floor side facing windows proposed shall be obscure glazed and non-opening for a height of 1.7m as measured from finished floor level.
Reason: To protect the privacy of neighbouring residential occupiers in accordance with policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
